akn:section.akn:heading: Buyer’s right to goods on seller’s repudiation, failure to deliver, or insolvency.

akn:content.akn:p: Subject to subsections (2) and (3) and even though the goods have not been shipped, a buyer who has paid a part or all of the price of goods in which he has a special property under the provisions of § 28:2-501 may, on making and keeping good a tender of any unpaid portion of their price, recover them from the seller if:
The buyer’s right to recover the goods under subsection (1)(a) vests upon acquisition of a special property, even if the seller had not then repudiated or failed to deliver.
If the identification creating his special property has been made by the buyer he acquires the right to recover the goods only if they conform to the contract for sale.
